@Ashton51 wrote:

Exactly what everyone else said,

To be more specific you need to create a new character token. Plenty of tuts on this, just use the search function.

item.title: Minigame points saving
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

src > server > model > players > PlayerSave.java

This is where you can save your integer into your character’s file. Take a look at the code that is already there and you should catch on to the general idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Minigame points saving

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“chri55w, post:4, topic:386381”]if its PI
youll need to add it to the playersave.java otherwise it wont load it on next login

not sure about other sources but youll defo need to add it to the save method

hope this helps[/quote]
I know Delta uses savegame void in client.java (along with many other bases i cba to name), to add to the help a tad.

item.title: Minigame points saving
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

I think your calling the wrong class; your calling PlayerHandler, but Player usually holds the token integers.

Try using “temp.SkeletonKilled += 1;”

Read full topic

item.title: Minigame points saving
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

Hi, i have my own minigame called skeleton killer. kill skeletons, get points, earn prizes. but the problem is, everytime you log out or get dc’ed, you lose your points. heres is the npc codes, if you need it.

if (npcs[i].npcType == 90) { PlayerHandler.SkeletonKilled += 1; temp.SkeletonKilled += 1 + misc.random(2); } if (npcs[i].npcType == 1973) { PlayerHandler.SkeletonKilled += 1; temp.SkeletonKilled += 3; }

If you need any other codes like the tokens, etc just ask. Btw what would i change here to safe [if needed]

Read full topic
